SummaryOfDirectChrtblActyGrp.Description1Txt: GLOBAL DEVELOPMENT PROGRAM - SUPPORT VARIOUS INCOUNTRY POLIO ERADICATION PROGRAMS; IPV INTRODUCTION SUPPORT; WORK TO DEVELOP A NEW TECHNOLOGY THAT WILL INCREASE THE EFFICIENCY, EFFICACY, & AFFORDABILITY OF EMPTYING PIT LATRINES & SEPTIC TANKS; CONVENED GRANTEES TO PROMOTE COLLABORATION, IMPROVE PROGRAMS & STRENGTHEN THE GRANTEE NETWORK; STUDIES ON AGRICULTURAL VALUE CHAINS FOR LIVESTOCK & CROPS; SUPPLY CHAIN IMPROVEMENT STUDIES IN MULTIPLE COUNTRIES; ASSISTED ORGANIZATIONS IN DEVELOPING INNOVATIVE FINANCING MECHANISMS & PRICING STRATEGIES TO IMPROVE GLOBAL ACCESS TO VACCINES, ESSENTIAL MEDICINES AND FAMILY HEALTH PRODUCTS; SUPPORTED GRANTEES IN CREATING PLANS FOR INTRODUCING HEALTH CARE & VACCINATION PROGRAMS & FOR RESPONDING TO WIDESPREAD HEALTH CRISES & PANDEMICS; UNDERSTANDING FINANCIAL MARKETS AND DIGITAL SERVICES IN MULTIPLE COUNTRIES; POLIO GPS TRACKING AND ANALYSIS; STRATEGIC PROJECT MANAGEMENT; STRATEGY SUPPORT; EVALUATION, COMMUNICATION AND ADVOCACY SUPPORT.
SummaryOfDirectChrtblActyGrp.Description2Txt: GLOBAL HEALTH PROGRAM - FUNDING FOR DISCOVERY, DEVELOPMENT, AND DELIVERY OF HIGH IMPACT GLOBAL HEALTH INTERVENTIONS. ENGAGE WITH NON-PROFIT, PUBLIC, AND COMMERCIAL PARTNERS TO IDENTIFY NOVEL PLATFORMS, PROCESSES, AND TECHNIQUES THAT ACCELERATE THE TIMELINE, REDUCE COST, AND REDUCE RISK FOR INTRODUCTION OF NEW AND AFFORDABLE VACCINES, MEDICINES, DIAGNOSTICS, AND DEVICES FOR DISEASES OF HIGH BURDEN IN THE DEVELOPING WORLD. ADVISE GLOBAL HEALTH GRANTEES IN DEVELOPING IMPACTFUL ADVOCACY AND COMMUNICATIONS STRATEGIES. CONVENE GLOBAL HEALTH GRANTEES TO SHARE RESEARCH FINDINGS, INNOVATIONS, AND BEST PRACTICES IN NUMEROUS AREAS OF GLOBAL HEALTH AND MEDICINE.
SummaryOfDirectChrtblActyGrp.Description3Txt: US PROGRAM - CONDUCTED AND EVALUATED RESEARCH ON ISSUES OF INTEREST TO THE FIELD OF EDUCATION AND FAMILY HOMELESSNESS. ASSISTED ORGANIZATIONS WORKING IN THE AREA OF EDUCATIONAL IMPROVEMENTS IN ASSESSING PROGRESS ON CURRENT PROJECTS, CONDUCTING BUSINESS PLANNING, COMMUNICATIONS SUPPORT, AND TECHNICAL SUPPORT.
SummaryOfDirectChrtblActyGrp.Description4Txt: GLOBAL POLICY AND ADVOCACY - SUPPORTED ACTIVITIES TO CULTIVATE NEW STRATEGIC PARTNERSHIPS AND TO ENCOURAGE INCREASED PRIVATE FUNDING FOR GLOBAL HEALTH AND GLOBAL DEVELOPMENT IN THE US AND ABROAD; COMMISSIONED WORK TO PROVIDE IN-DEPTH RESEARCH AND ANALYSIS ON POLICY DEVELOPMENTS, INITIATIVES AND GAPS IN ADVOCACY WORK FOCUSED ON FAMILY HEALTH/AGRICULTURE, HIV/MALARIA/TB/NIDS, POLIO, TOBACCO, VACCINES AND CHILD HEALTH; SUPPORTED TARGETED OUTREACH EFFORTS FOR A GENERAL EDUCATION CAMPAIGN SURROUNDING THE SOCIAL AND MORAL BENEFITS ASSOCIATED WITH FAMILY PLANNING; COMMISSIONED ANALYSIS OF OFFICIAL DEVELOPMENT ASSISTANCE LANDSCAPE AND OUTLOOK, GLOBAL GROWTH TRENDS AND IMPLICATIONS.

SumOfProgramRelatedInvstGrp.Description1Txt: BEIJING TIANTAN BIOLOGICAL PRODUCTS CO. LTD. - A DEBT PROGRAM RELATED INVESTMENT TO HELP SECURE AFFORDABLE BIVALENT ORAL POLIO VACCINE NEEDED FOR POLIO ERADICATION.
SumOfProgramRelatedInvstGrp.Description2Txt: ANACOR PHARMACEUTICALS - A DIRECT EQUITY PROGRAM RELATED INVESTMENT TO ACCELERATE THE APPLICATION OF A BORON CHEMISTRY PLATFORM TO RAPIDLY AND EFFICIENTLY DELIVER INNOVATIVE AND USEFUL DRUGS FOR NEGLECTED DISEASES.

ApplicationSubmissionInfoGrp.RestrictionsOnAwardsTxt: THE GLOBAL HEALTH PROGRAM AND PACIFIC NORTHWEST INITIATIVE ACCEPT UNSOLICITED LETTERS OF INQUIRY IN SPECIFIC AREAS OR IN RESPONSE TO A REQUEST FOR PROPOSAL. THE GLOBAL DEVELOPMENT PROGRAM DOES NOT ACCEPT UNSOLICITED REQUESTS FOR FUNDING AND ONLY ACCEPTS RESPONSES TO A REQUEST FOR PROPOSAL. THE EDUCATION INITIATIVE AND THE LIBRARIES INITIATIVE PROACTIVELY IDENTIFY RECIPIENTS AND DO NOT ACCEPT UNSOLICITED REQUESTS. FOR MORE INFORMATION, SEE WWW.GATESFOUNDATION.ORG OR SEND REQUESTS TO THE INQUIRY ADMINISTRATORS AT THE ADDRESS INDICATED IN PART XV, LINE 2A.

BLOOMBOARD, INC. - A DIRECT EQUITY PROGRAM RELATED INVESTMENT TO CATALYZE DEVELOPMENT OF TEACHER EVALUATION TOOLS AND DEPLOY SUCH TOOLS IN STATE EDUCATION SYSTEMS THAT SERVE A SIGNIFICANT PORTION OF LOW-INCOME STUDENTS.

GENOCEA BIOSCIENCES, INC. - A DIRECT EQUITY PROGRAM RELATED INVESTMENT TO POTENTIALLY IMPROVE THE EFFECTIVENESS OF VACCINE CANDIDATES AND REDUCE THE TIME NEEDED TO CREATE VACCINE CANDIDATE CATEGORIES, PARTICULARLY MALARIA.
CIVIC RI PRI FUND, LLC - A DEBT PROGRAM RELATED INVESTMENT TO PROVIDE LOW-COST SCHOOL FACILITY SUPPORT FOR MEMBERS OF THE CENTRAL FALLS, RI DISTRICT-CHARTER COMPACT.

VISTERRA, INC. - A DIRECT EQUITY PROGRAM RELATED INVESTMENT TO DEVELOP A PLATFORM USEFUL FOR UNDERSTANDING AND CHARACTERIZING PROTEINS AS 'NETWORKS' OF AMINO ACIDS, ENABLING THE IDENTIFICATION OF UNIQUE EPITOPES CRITICAL TO STRUCTURE, FUNCTION AND THE DIRECTED DESIGN OF ANTIBODIES.

AFRICAN AGRICULTURAL CAPITAL FUND LLC - AN EQUITY FUND PROGRAM RELATED INVESTMENT TO INCREASE THE AVAILABLITY OF CAPITAL TO EARLY-STAGE AGRICULTURAL ENTERPRISES WHOSE BUSINESS MODELS DIRECTLY ENGAGE SMALLHOLDER FARMERS IN SUB-SAHARAN AFRICA.
M-KOPA, LLC - A DEBT PROGRAM RELATED INVESTMENT TO SUPPORT AN INNOVATIVE ASSET-BASED LENDING MODEL FOR LOW INCOME CUSTOMERS IN KENYA.

GLOBAL HEALTH INVESTMENT FUND - A DEBT PROGRAM RELATED INVESTMENT TO IMPROVE GLOBAL HEALTH BY PROVIDING FUNDING TO SUPPORT THE DEVELOPMENT, PRODUCTION AND COMMERCIALIZATION OF DRUGS, VACCINES, PREVENTATIVES, DIAGNOSTICS AND OTHER RELATED TECHNOLOGIES.

THE AFRICA HEALTH FUND LLC - A DIRECT EQUITY PROGRAM RELATED INVESTMENT TO DEVELOP A DOUBLE-BOTTOM LINE PRIVATE EQUITY FUND TO INVEST IN PRIVATE PROVIDERS OF HEALTHCARE TO THE POOR IN SUB-SAHARAN AFRICA.

GeneralExplanationGrp.MediumExplanationTxt: DURING THE 2013 TAX YEAR, THE BILL & MELINDA GATES FOUNDATION DISTRIBUTED $30,000 TO A DONOR ADVISED FUND AS A QUALIFYING DISTRIBUTION. THE DISTRIBUTION WILL BE USED TO SUPPORT IRC 509(A)(1) AND IRC 509(A)(2) PUBLICLY SUPPORTED ORGANIZATIONS TO ACCOMPLISH THEIR MISSIONS UNDER IRC 170(C)(2)(B).

THE FIVE EMPLOYEES LISTED IN PART VIII, LINE 2 WERE ALL ON FOREIGN ASSIGNMENT DURING 2013. THEIR COMPENSATION INCLUDES TAX EQUALIZATION, HOUSING ALLOWANCES, TUITION ASSISTANCE, AND OTHER TAXABLE BENEFITS RELATED TO THEIR ASSIGNMENT.

GeneralExplanationGrp.IdentifierTxt: AMOUNTS TREATED AS DISTRIB OUT OF CORPUS
GeneralExplanationGrp.MediumExplanationTxt: AMOUNT REPORTED ON PART XIII, LINE 7 AS OUT OF CORPUS DISTRIBUTIONS IN SATISFACTION OF REDISTRIBUTION UNDER TREAS. REG. 53.4942(A)-3(C)(2) ARE ALL MADE FROM CURRENT YEAR QUALIFYING DISTRIBUTIONS. THE ENTIRE $2,158,000,000 REPRESENTS QUALIFYING DISTRIBUTIONS MADE TO THE FOUNDATION BY BILL & MELINDA GATES FOUNDATION TRUST, EIN 91-1663695, DURING THE TAX YEAR ENDED 12/31/2013.
